summary: The 'Forging Ahead on Rail Electrification Act' (FARE Act) directs the Chairman of the Surface Transportation Board to create an advisory committee on rail electrification. This committee will study and provide recommendations to address obstacles to rail electrification, emphasizing research and development. The committee will include representatives from passenger and freight railroads, electric utilities, equipment manufacturers, state governments, and federal agencies. The Chairman must submit reports to relevant Congressional committees every two years, with the committee terminating ten years after the Act's enactment.
